translation.en: But swearing… is definitely up there.

translation.ja: 怖がらせ 侮辱し 誘惑できる

translation.en: It's capable of expressing the full range of human emotion.

translation.ja: 痛み 驚き 情欲などすべてを表せる―

translation.en: They're the most popular and alluring taboos we have.

translation.en: But the secrets to their strange power have been shrouded in mystery. Until now.

translation.en: "Fuck" is the all-time classic. Number one with a bullet.

translation.en: If I had only one swear word to take with me to a desert island,

translation.en: it would probably be "fuck."

translation.en: I am a lexicographer and an author.

translation.en: My name is Ben Bergen and I'm a cognitive scientist. I do research on language.

translation.en: You can use "fuck" in absolutely any way.

translation.en: "You little fucker." It could be a good thing.
translation.ja: ロンドン･ヒューズ いつも使ってるわ ロンドン･ヒューズ ロンドン･ヒューズ いい意味でも使える いい意味でも使える

translation.en: My name is Melissa Mohr
translation.ja: 私はスタンフォード大で博士号を取得し 私はスタンフォード大で博士号を取得しメリッサ･モーア

translation.ja: 私はスタンフォード大で博士号を取得しメリッサ･モーア

translation.en: and I write about swearing.

translation.en: If you hear someone say "fuck," that word has-- has a lot of power.
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)には威力があります

translation.en: It can work with when you're shocked.
translation.ja: ショックの表現

translation.en: "Fuck!"
translation.ja: マジ(ファック)？ ジョエル･キム･ブースター

translation.en: It can work with when you're surprised.

translation.en: "Shut the fuck up!"
translation.ja: デレイ･デイヴィス うそだろ(ファック)？

translation.en: "Fuck" is just the most acceptable curse word, but it still is the worst one of all.
translation.ja: 一番受け入れられてるけど同時に 一番ひどい卑語よ

translation.en: But for all its myriad uses, "fuck" is ultimately about fuck-ing.
translation.ja: さまざまな使い方はあるが主な意味は“性交”

translation.en: So, where did the word itself come from?
translation.ja: その語源は？

translation.en: [Ben] With "fuck,"
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)の語源は？ ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)には数千年間― ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)には数千年間―

translation.en: it has a really long history of not meaning something related to sex.
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)には数千年間―５世紀～13世紀 ５世紀～13世紀 ５世紀～13世紀〝性交〞という意味はありませんでした

translation.en: Thousands of years.
translation.ja: 〝性交〞という意味はありませんでした

translation.en: And, starting right around the beginning of the 14th century,

translation.en: and probably preserved it

translation.en: without ever being a banned term
translation.ja: しかし禁句ではなく約４００年間はヴィクトリア朝 しかし禁句ではなく約４００年間は しかし禁句ではなく約４００年間は卑俗的な意味に

translation.en: for about 400 years.
translation.ja: 卑俗的な意味に普通に使われていました 普通に使われていました

translation.en: So, there's an acronymic etymology
translation.ja: ある成句の頭字語が ある成句の頭字語が 頭字語 語源説

translation.en: that people think the word "fuck" came from a phrase,
translation.ja: 頭字語 語源説 語源だという説があります

translation.en: "Fornication Under Consent of the King."
translation.ja: “王の承認後の性交(Ｆ　Ｕ　Ｃ　Ｋ)”

translation.en: -The idea is… -[neighing] …that when people in the middle ages got married,

translation.en: they had to go to the king, they had to ask for permission to have sex.
translation.ja: 王の許可が必要だったというのです

translation.en: -[woman] Oh, don't stop! -[crashing] Oh, I'm almost thither! [gasps]

translation.en: to fuuuuuck!

translation.en: Such a great story for such a great word.

translation.en: It is total horseshit. It's not real. Sadly.
translation.ja: まったくのデタラメです 面白い語源を期待したのに残念ですね

translation.en: Because we like colorful words to have colorful origins.

translation.en: I think "fuck" is just made up. I feel like this one guy one day just went, "Fuck."

translation.en: That's exactly how I feel, actually."

translation.en: The best that etymologists can tell,
translation.ja: 語源学的には―

translation.en: which means "to blow," "to hit," "to strike."

translation.en: before the 1500s.
translation.ja: １５００年代以前の書物では稀(まれ)でした

translation.en: But there are some uses of the word, and they occur in people's names.

translation.en: So, there's a man called John Lefucker.
translation.ja: ジョン･ルファッカー

translation.en: Who was a known gigolo in the area.

translation.en: Incredibly well endowed.

translation.en: What? Are you crazy?

translation.en: It could refer to the fact that he is, um…

translation.en: an inelegant copulator.

translation.en: But it could also mean that he got hit in the stomach. Or that he punches people in the stomach.

translation.en: We just-- With names, you don't really know, because they tend to be metaphorical, or--

translation.en: You know, nicknames aren't necessarily explainable if you're outside of that in-group.
translation.ja: 仲間内にしか分からないあだ名もありますよね

translation.en: A lot of people's last names in English come from their profession, or some characteristic they're known by.

translation.en: So, you've got-- In the 13th century, you've got John Lefucker.

translation.en: There's so many different ways to talk about "fuck."
translation.ja: さまざまな見方がある

translation.en: You have the Fuck Family Tree,
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)家系図では―

translation.en: and those two fuck and they have a Fuccboi.

translation.en: with this absolute fuck fiend, Fuckin' Brenda.
translation.ja: ファッキン･ブレンダとね

translation.en: They all fucked. But the motherfucker's brother,

translation.ja: その遺産でみんなヤリたい放題だ

translation.ja: 他の親戚もしょうもないヤツらばかり

translation.en: "Fuck" means "sex," for sure.
translation.ja: 〝性交〞の意味だけではありません

translation.en: And then you can move outward
translation.ja: 〝性交〞の意味だけではありません 〝性交〞の意味だけではありません動詞　性行為を行う

translation.en: and say, well, "fuck" also refers to really mess something up,
translation.ja: 動詞　性行為を行う 動詞　性行為を行う〝大失敗〞や― 〝大失敗〞や― 〝人をだます〞という意味も

translation.en: or "fuck" meaning "to screw someone over."
translation.ja: 〝人をだます〞という意味も

translation.en: These are all metaphorical uses.

translation.en: And-- and the fact that it's so taboo, and has been taboo for a while,
translation.ja: 禁句とされてきたからこそ―

translation.en: you know, it's kinda like Silly Putty-- you can stretch it into just about any meaning you need to.
translation.ja: 粘土のように 自由自在に意味を伸ばせるのです

translation.en: [Nicolas] Where does "fuck" live in your brain?
translation.ja: 脳内のｆｕｃｋ(ファック)の場所は？

translation.en: When you automatically, spontaneously swear, it's an evolutionary old reflex.
translation.ja: 自然と卑語が出てくるのは人間本来の条件反射です

translation.en: Apparently, swear words live in, like, a different part of your brain.
translation.ja: 卑語は 脳内の― 実家の地下室みたいな所にあるらしいわ

translation.en: They live in, like, the mom's basement of your brain.
translation.ja: 実家の地下室みたいな所にあるらしいわ

translation.en: And I'm goin' to that part of my brain a lot.
translation.ja: 私がよく行く場所

translation.en: There's a deeper, more emotional, evolutionarily old place that profanity comes from.
translation.ja: 卑語は 感情と関係する進化的に古い場所から来ます

translation.en: Deep in the middle of the brain,
translation.ja: 脳の中心にある部分で

translation.en: a part of the brain we share with other primates,
translation.ja: 脳の中心にある部分で 哺乳類やトカゲにもあります

translation.en: with other mammals, with lizards.
translation.ja: 哺乳類やトカゲにもあります

translation.en: That's the part that leads you to swear when you stub a toe,
translation.ja: つま先をぶつけたり試合で歓喜した瞬間―

translation.en: or when your favorite football team scores a touchdown.
translation.ja: つま先をぶつけたり試合で歓喜した瞬間― ここから卑語が出ます

translation.en: If something is tragic, my reaction will involve the word "fuck."
translation.ja: 悲劇が起きたら“ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”と言うだろう

translation.en: When you swear, you produce adrenaline.
translation.ja: 卑語を言うとアドレナリンが出ます

translation.en: It's part of the same fight-or-flight reaction people have when they experience fear or anger.
translation.ja: 恐怖や怒りに対する闘争逃走反応と同じです

translation.en: It can cause the listener's heart rate to increase, make your palms sweat.
translation.ja: 聞き手の心拍数を上げ手に汗をかきます

translation.en: You fuckin' do that again and I will shoot you myself.
translation.ja: 次は撃つ(ファッキン)ぞ 「ジャーヘッド」

translation.en: That adrenaline and the blood flow to the extremities makes it easier to tolerate pain there.
translation.ja: アドレナリンと血流の増加で痛みに耐えやすくなり

translation.en: It's also the same reason why swearing makes you stronger.
translation.ja: 実際に力も強くなるのです

translation.en: For example, five percent stronger in grip strength when you're swearing, compared to when you're not.
translation.ja: 例えば 卑語を使うと握力が５％上がります

translation.en: [Nicolas] "Fuck!"
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)

translation.en: It's so primal, so universal,
translation.ja: 原始的で 幅広く使える

translation.en: that some of history's most famous people channeled its power for their last words.
translation.ja: 歴史上の人物も最期の言葉として残した

translation.en: Like beloved children's author Roald Dahl.
translation.ja: 人々に愛された児童文学作家

translation.en: "It's just that I will miss you all so much."

translation.en: "God damn the whole fuckin' world and everyone in it but you, Carlotta."

translation.en: And even Venezuelan freedom fighter, Antonio José de Sucre.
translation.ja: Ｗ･Ｃ･フィールズベネズエラの自由戦士さえも ベネズエラの自由戦士さえも

translation.ja: アントニオ･ホセ･デ･スクレ アントニオ･ホセ･デ･スクレファック　銃創(じゅうそう)か

translation.en: Every single person who's fallen off a cliff, their last word was "fuck."

translation.en: Everyone who's been eaten by a shark, they also said "fuck."
translation.ja: 崖から落ちたりサメに食われたら― みんな言うはずだよ

translation.en: I'm not surprised. I feel like that's probably a lot of people's last words.
translation.ja: 多くの人の最期の言葉だろうね

translation.en: I'm Elvis Mitchel,
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は言論の自由で守られる私はラジオ番組の司会者だ 私はラジオ番組の司会者だ 私はラジオ番組の司会者だエルヴィス･ミッチェル映画評論家

translation.en: and I host a show called The Treatment on KCRW.
translation.ja: 私はラジオ番組の司会者だエルヴィス･ミッチェル映画評論家

translation.en: Thanks to the Supreme Court and the ruling of 1971,
translation.ja: 1971年 最高裁の判決は

translation.en: "fuck" is part of our protected speech, we have the right to say it. We have what they would call "the God-given right."
translation.ja: “ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”と言うことは神から与えられた権利とした

translation.en: Using the word "fuck" becomes a way to be heard.
translation.ja: 自分の声を届ける手段だ

translation.en: Certainly-- In the '60s, Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland,
translation.ja: 60年代ジェーン･フォンダらは

translation.en: they had a touring troupe, FTA. Fuck The Army. And Fuck The Draft.
translation.ja: この言葉で徴兵反対運動をした

translation.en: You were using that word to say, "I was taking a stand."
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)を利用した主張だ

translation.en: "Fuck" is also something a person says when they are deeply hurt
translation.ja: 深く傷ついたときや落胆したときにも使う 深く傷ついたときや落胆したときにも使う オープンマイク･イーグル

translation.en: or disappointed by something.
translation.ja: 深く傷ついたときや落胆したときにも使う オープンマイク･イーグル

translation.en: ♪ Fuck tha police Comin' straight from the underground… ♪
translation.ja: ファック･ザ･ポリス

translation.en: When NWA said "Fuck Tha Police,"
translation.ja: ＮＷＡのあのリリックは―徴兵反対(ファック) ＮＷＡのあのリリックは― ＮＷＡのあのリリックは―ファック･ザ･ポリス

translation.en: it wasn't said out of a sense of pure malice. It was said with a deep sense of disappointment.
translation.ja: 悪意ではなく深い落胆を表現したんだ

translation.en: ♪ Fuck tha police ♪ ♪ Fuck, fuck, fuck tha police ♪
translation.ja: ファック･ザ･ポリス　　ファック･ザ･ポリス

translation.en: -♪ Fuck, fuck, fuck… ♪ -That's what "Fuck Tha Police" did.
translation.ja: それが あの曲の功績だ

translation.en: That's what those words did.
translation.ja: それが あの曲の功績だ 〝ファック･ザ･ポリス〞

translation.en: The power of NWA is that they were
translation.ja: 〝ファック･ザ･ポリス〞 〝ファック･ザ･ポリス〞 彼らは元祖ギャングスタ･ラッパー 彼らは元祖ギャングスタ･ラッパー

translation.en: some of the earliest successful gangsta rappers,
translation.ja: 彼らは元祖ギャングスタ･ラッパー

translation.en: and what gangsta rap really meant in that time… was people sayin' things on songs
translation.ja: 公の場では話されないような内容を―

translation.en: that people were not used to hearing in public.
translation.ja: 曲で表現したんだ

translation.en: Going to a Public Enemy show
translation.ja: 80年代彼らのライブに行くと

translation.en: or NWA in the '80s, and just watching the way Eazy-E--
translation.ja: 80年代彼らのライブに行くと ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)が詩的に使われてた

translation.en: It became lyrical, the way he used the word "fuck."
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)が詩的に使われてた

translation.en: ♪ …fucked up incident? ♪
translation.ja: ひどいぜ(ファック)

translation.en: And to watch the way Cube would react, and basically sort of--
translation.ja: アイス･キューブがコール＆レスポンスをする

translation.en: They'd do this call and response. That to me was art.
translation.ja: アイス･キューブがコール＆レスポンスをする ののしり言葉を芸術へと高めたんだ

translation.en: That was raising profanity to the level of art.
translation.ja: ののしり言葉を芸術へと高めたんだ

translation.en: And making that part of art, becomes part of a conversation we have every day, forever after.
translation.ja: その芸術が日常の話題の一部になった

translation.en: And, of course, the police did not like to hear this sentiment.
translation.ja: 当然 警察の反感を買った

translation.en: [woman] The group is NWA. The group's lyrics are anti-police and anti-authority.
translation.ja: ＮＷＡは リリックで警察や権力に反発

translation.en: I'm personally very offended.
translation.ja: 腹立たしい

translation.en: [Open Mike] They didn't invent the term "fuck the police."
translation.ja: 彼らが作ったフレーズじゃない

translation.en: But they said it out loud.
translation.ja: 公言しただけだ

translation.en: And it was analogous that that same year, 1989, Public Enemy says "Fight The Power."
translation.ja: 同年パブリック･エネミーも“権力と戦え”と言った

translation.en: So you got "Fight The Power" in New York, and you got "Fuck Tha Police" in LA. It's the same sentiment.
translation.ja: ニューヨークとＬＡから同じ主張が発信された

translation.en: It's just people finally saying these things on record,
translation.ja: ラップという新たな表現方法で―

translation.en: because we have this new form of expression called rap music
translation.ja: ラップという新たな表現方法で― 公言できなかったことをやっと主張できたんだ

translation.en: where it's okay to say things that you've been saying in secret.
translation.ja: 公言できなかったことをやっと主張できたんだ

translation.en: [Zainab] When you hear people say "Fuck the police,"
translation.ja: このフレーズの意味は― このフレーズの意味は― 〝ファック･ザ･ポリス〞

translation.en: it's like, "I have no other options.
translation.ja: 選択肢がないってこと

translation.en: And that's how I got here. Because there's no other option."
translation.ja: だから この表現にたどり着いた

translation.en: "Fuck" is a good protest word,
translation.ja: 〝白人結社(ファック)〞 〝白人結社(ファック)〞 抗議の言葉よ 抗議の言葉よ 抗議の言葉よ 〝富裕層(ファック)〞

translation.en: because it is the swear word that carries the most emotion.
translation.ja: 〝富裕層(ファック)〞 最も強く感情を表す言葉だから 最も強く感情を表す言葉だから

translation.en: [Elvis] People need to be offended, to be shaken out of their complacency,
translation.ja: 〝世界に対抗(ファック)〞 世間を刺激して― 〝大統領 くたばれ(ファック)〞 誤った信念を問いただすべきだ

translation.en: out of their misguided belief system.
translation.ja: 〝大統領 くたばれ(ファック)〞 誤った信念を問いただすべきだ 誤った信念を問いただすべきだ

translation.en: According to numerous studies,
translation.ja: 研究によるとｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は―

translation.en: "fuck" is not only the most used swear word in the English language,
translation.ja: 研究によるとｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は― 最も汎用(はんよう)されると同時に最も検閲される卑語だ 最も汎用(はんよう)されると同時に最も検閲される卑語だ卑語の使用頻度

translation.en: it's also the most censored.
translation.ja: 最も汎用(はんよう)されると同時に最も検閲される卑語だ卑語の使用頻度 最も汎用(はんよう)されると同時に最も検閲される卑語だ

translation.en: It's the granddaddy of cussing, and we can find it all around us.
translation.ja: 卑語の元祖 身近にあって最も汚い卑語の一つだ

translation.en: It's one of the oldest, most vulgar words we have,
translation.ja: 身近にあって最も汚い卑語の一つだ

translation.en: limitless in its ability to shock and offend.
translation.ja: その影響力は無限だ

translation.en: So, why do we see it now on cross-stitch and scented candles?
translation.ja: 今では至る所で見かけるのに―

translation.en: And if we see it everywhere, why is it still censored on TV and in movies?
translation.ja: なぜ テレビや映画で検閲される？

translation.en: Often there will be censorship.
translation.ja: 検閲は 多くの場合―

translation.en: Uh, generally, it's not government censorship, although it can be, like in the case of the Soviet Union.
translation.ja: 社会主義などではない限り政府の規制ではなく

translation.en: Often, it's people self-censoring,
translation.ja: 人々が決めることです

translation.en: like, just deciding that this is not…
translation.ja: 人々が決めることです これらの言葉が社会の風紀を乱し―

translation.en: these words have no place in public discourse.
translation.ja: これらの言葉が社会の風紀を乱し―

translation.en: they're harmful to morality, they're harmful to children, and so, we will not say these things.
translation.ja: 倫理や教育に反するとして自主規制します

translation.en: And of course, everybody does. But then they're shocked.
translation.ja: それを破ると驚かれる

translation.en: People just laugh when you say "fuck." It's just… everything's fuckin' funnier when you say "fuck."
translation.ja: “ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”をつけるとみんなにウケるわ

translation.en: I feel like swear words are definitely more powerful in America. Not that powerful in Britain.
translation.ja: 卑語の威力は英国より米国のほうが強いわ

translation.en: You can say, "Morning, you fucking cunt" to someone and they'll be fine.
translation.ja: 英国ではあいさつにも使える

translation.en: Say that to someone in America, you'll get shot,
translation.ja: 米国では撃たれる

translation.en: because guns are legal here.
translation.ja: 銃が合法だからね

translation.en: When you're being offended, you're basically saying to the world,
translation.ja: 卑語に嫌悪感を抱く人は

translation.en: "I have better morals than this person." "This person did this, but I'm better than them."
translation.ja: 自分のほうがモラルが高いと思ってるんだ

translation.en: They're not going home and going, "I couldn't believe the words I had to hear…"
translation.ja: “ひどい言葉を聞いた”と日記に書いたりはしない

translation.en: And if they are, they can fuck off. Like, what's the point?
translation.ja: 気にしてどうするんだ？

translation.en: They shouldn't be out in the general public and all that stuff.
translation.ja: 公共の場に出なきゃいい

translation.en: I think the word "fuck" has a baseline magic that can never be removed.
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)には揺るぎない力がある

translation.en: If somebody looks at you and says, "Fuck you," you're gonna feel that.
translation.ja: “ファック･ユー”は胸に刺さるセリフだ

translation.en: Just because it's more common, doesn't mean it's lost any power.
translation.ja: 頻繁に使われてもその力は失われない

translation.en: Those fucking killjoys at the Motion Picture Association of America
translation.ja: 米国映画協会は “ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”が２回以上出てくる映画を―

translation.en: still consider the word bad enough to slap an R rating
translation.ja: “ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”が２回以上出てくる映画を―

translation.en: on just about any movie that uses it more than twice.
translation.ja: Ｒ指定にしやがる

translation.en: Until the 1960s,
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)の映画への影響 １９６０年代まではヘイズ･コードで―

translation.en: you got-- basically you were graded by the Hays Code.
translation.ja: １９６０年代まではヘイズ･コードで―

translation.en: And there were things you just couldn't say.
translation.ja: 禁止用語があった

translation.en: Then Jack Valenti came along and the MPAA said, "Well, we're losing people.
translation.ja: しかし 映画協会は観客の減少を指摘

translation.en: There are movies coming from Europe where people talk about sex, and they apparently have sex in these movies.
translation.ja: 欧州の映画には性行為のシーンもあった

translation.en: We can't act like that doesn't happen anymore." So, you had to acknowledge that the real world existed.
translation.ja: 現実に対して目をつぶることはできない

translation.en: And the ratings offered ways to gently introduce the concept
translation.ja: レーティング指定により 徐々に現実を映画に反映させた

translation.en: of the real world to movies.
translation.ja: 徐々に現実を映画に反映させた

translation.en: With these rating, a G-rated movie
translation.ja: Ｇ指定はほのぼのした映画

translation.en: will have a lot of sunlight, and that's about it.
translation.ja: Ｇ指定はほのぼのした映画「ベイブ」

translation.en: That'll do, pig.
translation.ja: 「ベイブ」いいぞ

translation.en: That'll do.
translation.ja: よくやった

translation.en: You get to PG and there are levels of violence, maybe a couple of swear words.
translation.ja: ＰＧは多少の暴力や卑語もある

translation.en: Son of a bitch.
translation.ja: クソ野郎！

translation.en: For PG-13, you can use the word "fuck" and get away with it once.
translation.ja: ＰＧ13はｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は１回だけ ＰＧ13はｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は１回だけ「俺たちニュースキャスター」

translation.en: From the entire Channel 4 News team, I'm Veronica Corningstone.
translation.ja: 「俺たちニュースキャスター」チャンネル４ニュースです

translation.en: And I'm Ron Burgundy.
translation.ja: 「俺たちニュースキャスター」ロンです 「俺たちニュースキャスター」

translation.en: Go fuck yourself, San Diego.
translation.ja: くたばれ(ファック)

translation.en: It can't be about fucking.
translation.ja: 性交の意味以外

translation.en: And then you get to R,
translation.ja: Ｒ指定の映画ではリアルな口調が聞ける

translation.en: and you have movies where characters talk like real people.
translation.ja: Ｒ指定の映画ではリアルな口調が聞ける Ｒ指定の映画ではリアルな口調が聞ける「ブライズメイズ」ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)無制限

translation.en: Are you fucking kidding me?
translation.ja: 「ブライズメイズ」ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)無制限 「ブライズメイズ」ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)無制限ウソ(ファッキン)でしょ？

translation.en: Profanity was the life-preserver for movies. People went to the movies again.
translation.ja: 卑語が解禁されて映画は人気を取り戻した

translation.en: I think the first time I heard a curse was in the movies. I think my parents took us to see Coming to America.
translation.ja: 初めて卑語を聞いたのは親と見に行った映画の中

translation.en: Once they got to, like, Queens, he was like, "We've arrived," or something.
translation.ja: 主人公がクイーンズに到着して―

translation.en: And somebody was like, "Fuck you!" And he was like, "Yes, yes! Fuck you too!"
translation.ja: “ファック･ユー！”と言い合ってた

translation.en: [Sarah Silverman] I was in, um… School of Rock, and I remember, in between scenes,
translation.ja: 「スクール･オブ･ロック」で監督にこう言われた

translation.en: the director was saying, uh…
translation.ja: 「スクール･オブ･ロック」で監督にこう言われた ＰＧ13だからｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は１回だけ言えると

translation.en: "It's PG-13, so we can say 'shit' and we can say one 'fuck.'"
translation.ja: ＰＧ13だからｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は１回だけ言えると

translation.en: I pitched that, um, you don't use "fuck" at all,
translation.ja: こう提案した 本編ではｆｕｃｋ(ファック)を使わず―

translation.en: and then just the last, like, after the credits,
translation.ja: 本編ではｆｕｃｋ(ファック)を使わず― 最後のエンドロールで全員で叫ぼうってね

translation.en: every-- you know, the whole cast just goes, "Fuck!"
translation.ja: 最後のエンドロールで全員で叫ぼうってね

translation.en: They didn't do that.
translation.ja: 不採用

translation.en: Swearing in movies is big business.
translation.ja: 映画で卑語を使うとカネになる

translation.en: Just look at the filmography of one randomly generated actor.
translation.ja: とある俳優の作品記録を見よう とある俳優の作品記録を見よう ファック　71％ダム　19％

translation.en: You can see that of the big six swear words,
translation.ja: ファック　71％ダム　19％ ファック　71％ダム　19％ ６つの卑語のうち―

translation.en: "fuck" and its derivatives are by far the most frequent,
translation.ja: ファック　71％ダム　19％ ファックは最も頻度が高い ファックは最も頻度が高い ファックは最も頻度が高い ビッチ　８％そのほか　２％

translation.en: making up 71% of the curses uttered in the films of this random actor.
translation.ja: 全出演作の卑語の71％にもなる

translation.en: So who do you think is the sweariest actor of all time?
translation.ja: では 最も多く卑語を使う俳優は？

translation.en: Per movies, per swear words, per time on screen, I think Eddie Murphy is your number one.
translation.ja: 作品数や卑語数からしてエディー･マーフィーかな

translation.en: No. Samuel L. It has to be Samuel L. He's swearin'-- He don't get the role unless he can swear in it.
translation.ja: サミュエル･L･ジャクソンしかいないわ

translation.en: When you're talking about the word "fuck," it's hard not to really fall back on the connoisseur of fuck, Samuel L. Jackson.
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)の巨匠といえばサミュエル･L･ジャクソン

translation.en: What the fuck am I doin' in the back? You're the motherfucker should be on brain detail.
translation.ja: 「パルプ･フィクション」俺が後ろ？お前の責任(マザーファッカー)だろ

translation.en: I remember I went to see Snakes on a Plane only to see Samuel L. Jackson say,
translation.ja: 彼のののしりを聞くためだけに― 「スネーク･フライト」を見に行ったわ

translation.en: "I'm tired of these motherfuckin' snakes on this motherfuckin' plane."
translation.ja: 「スネーク･フライト」を見に行ったわ

translation.en: It was-- it was magical.
translation.ja: 最高だった

translation.en: The sweariest actor isn't Samuel L. Jackson,
translation.ja: 卑語ランキングのトップは彼やアル･パチーノではない 卑語ランキングのトップは彼やアル･パチーノではない ハリウッド卑語俳優ランキング

translation.en: Al Pacino, or my personal favorite, Yosemite Sam,
translation.ja: 卑語ランキングのトップは彼やアル･パチーノではない ハリウッド卑語俳優ランキング

translation.en: but… Jonah Hill.
translation.ja: ジョナ･ヒルだ

translation.en: And while Jonah Hill is known for his R-rated comedies,
translation.ja: 出演作のうち― 「ウルフ･オブ･ウォールストリート」

translation.en: it was The Wolf of Wall Street that made him the king of the curse words,
translation.ja: 「ウルフ･オブ･ウォールストリート」

translation.en: swearing a confounding 107 times in that movie alone.
translation.ja: 彼はこの作品で１０７回も卑語を使った

translation.en: -Jonah Hill? -Jonah Hill?
translation.ja: ジョナ？ ホントに？

translation.en: There's no-- Who's counting these? This is-- That's not true! That's not true!
translation.ja: 誰が数えたんだ？　ウソだろ

translation.en: How did Jonah Hill say it so many times?
translation.ja: そんなに言った？

translation.en: It wasn't until 2004 that "fuck" first arrived
translation.ja: テレビ初のｆｕｃｋ(ファック)の登場は―

translation.en: uncensored on the small screen
in an airing of South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut on Comedy Central.
translation.ja: コメディ･セントラルの「サウスパーク」

translation.en: But it was way back in 1970,
translation.ja: 映画では１９７０年

translation.en: when M*A*S*H dropped the first F-bomb in a major motion picture.
translation.ja: 「マッシュ」で初めて使われた

translation.en: Movies can still move the needle when it comes to characters…
translation.ja: 映画の登場人物の影響で―

translation.en: basically, in effect, inventing catchphrases.
translation.ja: 流行語が生まれる

translation.en: We see this happen with, uh… with newly-invented swear words.
translation.ja: 新たな卑語の造語もあります

translation.en: So MILF is the great example,
translation.ja: 例えばＭＩＬＦ(ミルフ)

translation.en: because we know exactly the thing that spread it throughout the world,
translation.ja: この言葉を世界中に広めたのが―

translation.en: which was this movie, which was American Pie in 1999.
translation.ja: 「アメリカン･パイ」です

translation.en: [John Cho] M-I-L-F.
translation.ja: 「アメリカン･パイ」 ヤリたいママ(ＭＩＬＦ)

translation.en: -A Mom I'd Like to Fuck. -[laughing] Yeah, dude!
translation.ja: 「アメリカン･パイ」 ヤリたいママ(ＭＩＬＦ) 「アメリカン･パイ」 「アメリカン･パイ」 マジで！

translation.en: If the best movies can do something that make us want to be like them,
translation.ja: おもしろい映画は影響力が強い

translation.en: and we hear something and, "Wow, that's perfect. That…
translation.ja: ＭＩＬＦ(ミルフ)のような言葉を聞いたら

translation.en: MILF? I'm usin' that. I'm gonna find a way to use that."
translation.ja: みんな使ってみたくなる

translation.en: And you hear that in American Pie, and then, ten years later,
translation.ja: その映画の10年後―

translation.en: on 30 Rock, there's a fake reality show called MILF Island.
translation.ja: 架空の番組名になるほど世間に広まった

translation.en: And it's everywhere. I mean, so…
translation.ja: 架空の番組名になるほど世間に広まった 今でも映画がきっかけで―

translation.en: movies still can… act as these catalysts
translation.ja: 今でも映画がきっかけで― 言葉の鮮度や魅力が保たれることがある

translation.en: for keeping the language alive in ways that are exciting.
translation.ja: 言葉の鮮度や魅力が保たれることがある

translation.en: I love "fuck." It's like the Tom Hanks of curse words.
translation.ja: ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)は卑語界のトム･ハンクスよ

translation.en: It can do anything, can be in anything, and we never get sick of it.
translation.ja: どんな役もできて 飽きない

translation.en: We need to be able to say swear words.
translation.ja: 卑語は自由に使えるべきだ

translation.en: We need to be able to say "fuck."
translation.ja: “ｆｕｃｋ(ファック)”とね

translation.en: It's a gateway for creativity,
translation.ja: 創造性への扉であり主張の表現方法だ

translation.en: it's a form of protest, and…
translation.ja: 創造性への扉であり主張の表現方法だ それに 健康的でもある

translation.en: it's good for us.
translation.ja: それに 健康的でもある

translation.en: -[bell dings] -I think there's a need now for swearing and profanity more than any other time.
translation.ja: 今は 卑語が必要とされる時代だ

translation.en: We need the relief, the release. That's really what profanity gives us.
translation.ja: 息抜きと発散が必要だからね

translation.en: "Oh, shit!"
translation.ja: “クソ！”

translation.en: Just a chance to get that kind of stuff out.
translation.ja: ガス抜きの機会だ

translation.en: Bitch. Fuck. Shit. Damn. Pussy. Dick.
translation.ja: ビッチ ファック クソ

translation.en: I like that there are words you can't say and that you can only say on special occasions.
translation.ja: 特別なときにしか使えない言葉って好きよ

translation.en: Like Christmas.
translation.ja: クリスマスとかね

translation.en: Swearing is important if you need it to get out your frustration
translation.ja: 卑語は大事よ 悩みやストレスを発散できるから

translation.en: or your despair.
translation.ja: 悩みやストレスを発散できるから

translation.en: What the fuck?
translation.ja: 一体何だ(ファック)？「俺たちポップスター」

translation.en: It's not important when you're just swearing for swearing's sake.
translation.ja: ただ言いたいだけなのはダメ

translation.en: Don't swear for swearing's sake. We're better than that. Swear because you mean it.
translation.ja: ちゃんと意味を込めて使うべきよ

translation.en: I'm Nicolas Cage. Have a great fuckin' night.
translation.ja: ニコラス･ケイジでしたよい夜を(ファッキン･ナイト)
